description: Retrieves the content and settings of a message template for messages that are sent through a push notification channel.

parameters.name: TemplateName
parameters.description: The name of the message template. A template name must start with an alphanumeric character and can contain a maximum of 128 characters. The characters can be alphanumeric characters, underscores (_), or hyphens (-). Template names are case sensitive.

parameters.name: Version
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the version of the message template to update, retrieve information about, or delete. To retrieve identifiers and other information for all the versions of a template, use the Template Versions resource. If specified, this value must match the identifier for an existing template version. If specified for an update operation, this value must match the identifier for the latest existing version of the template. This restriction helps ensure that race conditions don't occur. If you don't specify a value for this parameter, Amazon Pinpoint does the following: For a get operation, retrieves information about the active version of the template. For an update operation, saves the updates to (overwrites) the latest existing version of the template, if the create-new-version parameter isn't used or is set to false. For a delete operation, deletes the template, including all versions of the template.

nested_items.name: PushNotificationTemplateResponse
nested_items.description: Provides information about the content and settings for a message template that can be used in messages that are sent through a push notification channel.

nested_items.name: Action
nested_items.description: The action to occur if a recipient taps a push notification that's based on the message template. Valid values are:
OPEN_APP - Your app opens or it becomes the foreground app if it was sent to the background. This is the default action.
DEEP_LINK - Your app opens and displays a designated user interface in the app. This action uses the deep-linking features of the Android platform.
URL - The default mobile browser on the recipient's device opens and loads the web page at a URL that you specify.

nested_items.name: Body
nested_items.description: The message body to use in a push notification that's based on the message template.

nested_items.name: ImageIconUrl
nested_items.description: The URL of the large icon image to display in the content view of a push notification that's based on the message template.

nested_items.name: ImageUrl
nested_items.description: The URL of an image to display in a push notification that's based on the message template.

nested_items.name: RawContent
nested_items.description: The raw, JSON-formatted string to use as the payload for a push notification that's based on the message template. If specified, this value overrides all other content for the message template.

nested_items.name: SmallImageIconUrl
nested_items.description: The URL of the small icon image to display in the status bar and the content view of a push notification that's based on the message template.

nested_items.name: Sound
nested_items.description: The sound to play when a recipient receives a push notification that's based on the message template. You can use the default stream or specify the file name of a sound resource that's bundled in your app. On an Android platform, the sound file must reside in /res/raw/.

nested_items.name: Title
nested_items.description: The title to use in a push notification that's based on the message template. This title appears above the notification message on a recipient's device.

nested_items.name: Url
nested_items.description: The URL to open in a recipient's default mobile browser, if a recipient taps a push notification that's based on the message template and the value of the Action property is URL.

nested_items.name: Action
nested_items.description: The action to occur if a recipient taps a push notification that's based on the message template. Valid values are:
OPEN_APP - Your app opens or it becomes the foreground app if it was sent to the background. This is the default action.
DEEP_LINK - Your app opens and displays a designated user interface in the app. This setting uses the deep-linking features of the iOS platform.
URL - The default mobile browser on the recipient's device opens and loads the web page at a URL that you specify.

nested_items.name: Body
nested_items.description: The message body to use in push notifications that are based on the message template.

nested_items.name: MediaUrl
nested_items.description: The URL of an image or video to display in push notifications that are based on the message template.

nested_items.name: RawContent
nested_items.description: The raw, JSON-formatted string to use as the payload for push notifications that are based on the message template. If specified, this value overrides all other content for the message template.

nested_items.name: Sound
nested_items.description: The key for the sound to play when the recipient receives a push notification that's based on the message template. The value for this key is the name of a sound file in your app's main bundle or the Library/Sounds folder in your app's data container. If the sound file can't be found or you specify default for the value, the system plays the default alert sound.

nested_items.name: Url
nested_items.description: The URL to open in the recipient's default mobile browser, if a recipient taps a push notification that's based on the message template and the value of the Action property is URL.

nested_items.name: CreationDate
nested_items.description: The date, in ISO 8601 format, when the message template was created.

nested_items.name: Action
nested_items.description: The action to occur if a recipient taps a push notification that's based on the message template. Valid values are:
OPEN_APP - Your app opens or it becomes the foreground app if it was sent to the background. This is the default action.
DEEP_LINK - Your app opens and displays a designated user interface in the app. This setting uses the deep-linking features of the iOS and Android platforms.
URL - The default mobile browser on the recipient's device opens and loads the web page at a URL that you specify.

nested_items.name: DefaultSubstitutions
nested_items.description: The JSON object that specifies the default values that are used for message variables in the message template. This object is a set of key-value pairs. Each key defines a message variable in the template. The corresponding value defines the default value for that variable.

URL - The default mobile browser on the recipient's device opens and loads the web page at a URL that you specify.

nested_items.description: The date, in ISO 8601 format, when the message template was last modified.

nested_items.name: RecommenderId
nested_items.description: The unique identifier for the recommender model that's used by the message template.

nested_items.name: TemplateDescription
nested_items.description: The custom description of the message template.

nested_items.name: TemplateName
nested_items.description: The name of the message template.

nested_items.name: TemplateType
nested_items.description: The type of channel that the message template is designed for. For a push notification template, this value is PUSH.

nested_items.name: Version
nested_items.description: The unique identifier, as an integer, for the active version of the message template, or the version of the template that you specified by using the version parameter in your request.
